author: mehdi.aouadi
content: So what's the current state of testing? IMU we can't rebase onto GLOAS before having a full working ePBS implementation first (which is not the case for Teku yet). Should we keep the testing implementations on top of FULU for now? Otherwise we could have the GLOAS barebones without ePBS (data structures only without the ePBS logic) but that would be very hacky imo

author: jih2nn
content: I believe being based on no-op Gloas (i.e, without ePBS or whatnot) and staying there until ePBS spec and impl stablize was our last agreement. But staying on Fulu could be also fine, if no-op Gloas is a pain. What do you prefer?

author: nflaig
content: no-op gloas doesn't work if you plan to merge epbs changes into trunk branch so I'd rather prefer keep it on top of fulu and have the custom eip7805 fork for now
